weather_report:
As twilight approaches Downtown San Francisco, the city is kissed by the soft embrace of a fading sun, illuminating the skyline against a backdrop of mostly sunny skies. Although the temperature is beginning to dip, the pleasant early afternoon warmth, hovering around 54 degrees, invites leisurely strolls through park paths or casual gatherings at outdoor cafes. A gentle west wind, barely a whisper at times, offers a refreshing touch, further mellowing the atmosphere.

As daylight wanes, anticipation builds for the evening, when clouds are expected to blanket the city, wrapping it in a cozy shroud with low temperatures settling around 45 degrees. Snuggle into a light jacket or a soft cardigan while venturing out; the breezy evening doesn't demand heavy clothing, but the subtle coolness reminds us of winter's presence. This is an ideal time to enjoy intimate conversations over a warm cup at a cozy café or perhaps to gather with friends for a board game night, savoring the shared warmth as the bustling city slows into its quieter hours. Amid this scenic shift, there are hints of fog in the distance, suggesting the marine layer may envelop parts of the bay later on—something to keep in mind for evening adventures.
